newsitem.title: USA: Exide Electronics wins Air Force contract.
newsitem.headline: Exide Electronics wins Air Force contract.

text.p: Exide Electronics Group Inc. said Monday it has won a contract from the Air Force with a potential value of $625 million to provide and service power supply systems.
The Raleigh, N.C.-based company said the contract, effective immediately, is worth $375 million for the first three years and $125 million for each of two optional years.
Revenues from the contract would depend on actual requirements and purchases, if any, made by the Air Force and other agencies.
Under the contract, Exide will provide power systems as well an ancillary equipment, spare parts, training, installation and maintenance services.
Exide's stock rose $3.375 to $12.50 on Nasdaq in aftenroon trading.
